Author: tendersandwich
Text: I really don't think you should worry about it! It might be water retention or muscle gain - it happens a lot with people who work out. Weighting yourself is not the most reliable way to measure how thin you're getting, but measuring different parts of your body. There are people who work out and get so much thinner without losing actual weight (muscle has a bigger density than fat)

Author: lameanonymous
Text: It could be muscle gain or water retention from working out! If you’ve been eating under maintenance, I promise you’re doing fine, you might see a whoosh later on!
